name: 'Message Of The Week' Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 7 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who was Arnold Vinick's candidate for Vice President?
questions.explanation:
Ray Sullivan.

	Ray Sullivan, Governor of West Virginia, was played by Brett Cullen. Brett played Ray in two season six episodes of "The West Wing."

questions.text: Who quit the Vinick campaign at the end of the show?
questions.explanation:
Leon.

	Leon explained to Vinick at the end of the show that he had to quit because he wasn't doing what he thought he would be doing when the campaign started.

questions.text: On what news program did Vinick appear?
questions.explanation:
Hardball.

	Chris Matthews from "Hardball" appeared as himself when interviewing Vinick on television.

questions.text: What is Vinick's secret service name?
questions.explanation:
Big Sur.

	The Secret Service say Vinick's code name after a speech he made.

questions.text: Bruno called Santos' Marine Corp Reserve Training the 'big stunt'.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Bruno had everyone else referring to Santos' Marine Corp Reserve Training as 'the big stunt'.

questions.text: How many weeks into the Santos-Vinick Presidential campaign were they?
questions.explanation:
3.

	It was said several different times throughout the show how many weeks they were into the campaign.

questions.text: What was the sound byte that Vinick gave the press during an interview?
questions.correct: "I hope he (Santos) will keep doing it after I'm Commander-In-Chief."
options: "Can we really afford to have Leo McGarry as Vice President?"
"Maybe Josh Lyman should be running for President."
"When the President finds the leak, he should turn off the faucet permanently."
questions.explanation:
"I hope he (Santos) will keep doing it after I'm Commander-In-Chief."

	Vinick had come out of a building after doing approval ads for his television spots and was asked about Santos' Army "stunt". His campaign staff thought what he did was the wrong thing to do because it would shine more light on Santos.

questions.text: What did Dan call the vigilantes that guarded the U.S./Mexican border?
options: Vinick's way to the White House
questions.explanation:
Minutemen.

	When it was suggested that Vinick meet with the minutemen, Bruno asked if there was a local chapter of the Klan there so they could drop by and see them.

questions.text: Vinick agreed to have pro-life judges on the bench when he became President.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Vinick was pressured into agreeing to George Rohr's terms on having pro-life judges on the bench when he's President. He later told Sheila, his campaign manager, that he lied and he never wanted George Rohr in the White House when he became President.

questions.text: Before Vinick changed his message of the week, what was it originally?
options: Security leak in the White House
More patrol officers on the border
questions.explanation:
Homeland Security.

	The Vinick campaign changed its message of the week to immigration issues after realizing that they could shake the Santos campaign by going for the Latino vote.
